trans-unit.source: Browsing Service Bus Resources with the Visual Studio Server Explorer
trans-unit.target: Browsing Service Bus Resources with the Visual Studio Server Explorer

trans-unit.source: <token>wazvstools1</token> includes Server Explorer support for managing <token>sb2</token> messaging entities, such as queues and topics.
trans-unit.target: <token>wazvstools1</token> includes Server Explorer support for managing <token>sb2</token> messaging entities, such as queues and topics.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui><token>sb2</token></ui> node in Server Explorer to create, delete, and modify the properties of messaging entities in a given <token>servicensd</token>.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui><token>sb2</token></ui> node in Server Explorer to create, delete, and modify the properties of messaging entities in a given <token>servicensd</token>.

trans-unit.source: To display Server Explorer in <token>vs_current_short</token>, from the menu bar choose <ui>View</ui>, then click <ui>Server Explorer</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To display Server Explorer in <token>vs_current_short</token>, from the menu bar choose <ui>View</ui>, then click <ui>Server Explorer</ui>.

trans-unit.source: An <embeddedLabel>Azure</embeddedLabel> node appears within the Server Explorer hierarchy, as in the following figure:
trans-unit.target: An <embeddedLabel>Azure</embeddedLabel> node appears within the Server Explorer hierarchy, as in the following figure:

trans-unit.source: Connect to a <token>servicensd</token>
trans-unit.target: Connect to a <token>servicensd</token>

trans-unit.source: To connect Server Explorer to a <token>sb2</token> <token>servicensd</token>, right-click <ui><token>sb2</token></ui>, then click <ui>Add New Connection</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To connect Server Explorer to a <token>sb2</token> <token>servicensd</token>, right-click <ui><token>sb2</token></ui>, then click <ui>Add New Connection</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Add Connection</ui> dialog enables you to choose whether to connect using a connection string, or manually enter the credentials.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Add Connection</ui> dialog enables you to choose whether to connect using a connection string, or manually enter the credentials.

trans-unit.source: You can also choose between connecting to a <token>servicensd</token> in <token>sb1</token> (cloud service) or <token>sb_onprem</token> (on-premises).
trans-unit.target: You can also choose between connecting to a <token>servicensd</token> in <token>sb1</token> (cloud service) or <token>sb_onprem</token> (on-premises).

trans-unit.source: For manual entry, type the name of the <token>servicensd</token>, the issuer name, and the issuer key.
trans-unit.target: For manual entry, type the name of the <token>servicensd</token>, the issuer name, and the issuer key.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can enter the connection string.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can enter the connection string.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain all of these values from the Azure management portal.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain all of these values from the Azure management portal.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="fa561f70-007c-45aa-b34d-56317dbbfc87" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create or Modify a Service Bus Service Namespace</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="fa561f70-007c-45aa-b34d-56317dbbfc87" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create or Modify a Service Bus Service Namespace</link>.

trans-unit.source: Then click <ui>OK</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Then click <ui>OK</ui>.

trans-unit.source: After you connect, a list of queues and topics you have created on that <token>servicensd</token> appears.
trans-unit.target: After you connect, a list of queues and topics you have created on that <token>servicensd</token> appears.

trans-unit.source: Manage messaging entities
trans-unit.target: Manage messaging entities

trans-unit.source: You can use Server Explorer to create new queues and topics, and to delete existing ones.
trans-unit.target: You can use Server Explorer to create new queues and topics, and to delete existing ones.

trans-unit.source: You can also send and receive test messages.
trans-unit.target: You can also send and receive test messages.

trans-unit.source: To create a new queue, right-click <ui>Queues</ui> in the Server Explorer hierarchy, then click <ui>Create New Queue</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To create a new queue, right-click <ui>Queues</ui> in the Server Explorer hierarchy, then click <ui>Create New Queue</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>New Queue</ui> dialog appears, in which you can set properties on the queue.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>New Queue</ui> dialog appears, in which you can set properties on the queue.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>OK</ui> to create the queue.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>OK</ui> to create the queue.

trans-unit.source: To create a topic in Server Explorer, follow the same procedure as above, but right-click <ui>Topics</ui>, then <ui>Create New Topic</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To create a topic in Server Explorer, follow the same procedure as above, but right-click <ui>Topics</ui>, then <ui>Create New Topic</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To create a subscription to that topic, right-click the name of the topic, then click <ui>Create New Subscription</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To create a subscription to that topic, right-click the name of the topic, then click <ui>Create New Subscription</ui>.

trans-unit.source: You can also use Server Explorer to create rules within each subscription.
trans-unit.target: You can also use Server Explorer to create rules within each subscription.

trans-unit.source: Update messaging entities
trans-unit.target: Update messaging entities

trans-unit.source: You can also use Server Explorer to update the properties of existing messaging entities.
trans-unit.target: You can also use Server Explorer to update the properties of existing messaging entities.

trans-unit.source: To do so, right-click the name of the entity, then click <ui>Update</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To do so, right-click the name of the entity, then click <ui>Update</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The same <ui>Properties</ui> dialog appears as pictured in “Manage Messaging Entities.”
trans-unit.target: The same <ui>Properties</ui> dialog appears as pictured in “Manage Messaging Entities.”

trans-unit.source: In this dialog, you can make changes to the properties of the entity.
trans-unit.target: In this dialog, you can make changes to the properties of the entity.

trans-unit.source: Send and receive test messages
trans-unit.target: Send and receive test messages

trans-unit.source: You can send and receive test messages to and from <token>sb2</token> messaging entities that use Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: You can send and receive test messages to and from <token>sb2</token> messaging entities that use Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: For example, to send a test message to a queue, right-click the name of the queue in Server Explorer, and then click <ui>Send a test message</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For example, to send a test message to a queue, right-click the name of the queue in Server Explorer, and then click <ui>Send a test message</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To receive the message, right-click the queue again, then click <ui>Receive message</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To receive the message, right-click the queue again, then click <ui>Receive message</ui>.

trans-unit.source: You can send multiple messages, and receive them in the order in which they were sent (first in, first out).
trans-unit.target: You can send multiple messages, and receive them in the order in which they were sent (first in, first out).

trans-unit.source: You can send one or more test messages to a topic by using Server Explorer, but to receive them, you must create a subscription.
trans-unit.target: You can send one or more test messages to a topic by using Server Explorer, but to receive them, you must create a subscription.

trans-unit.source: You cannot receive messages directly from a topic.
trans-unit.target: You cannot receive messages directly from a topic.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can do the following:
trans-unit.target: For example, you can do the following:

trans-unit.source: In Server Explorer, double-click the name of a topic to expand its hierarchy.
trans-unit.target: In Server Explorer, double-click the name of a topic to expand its hierarchy.

trans-unit.source: Under the topic name, right-click <ui>Subscriptions</ui>, then click <ui>Create New Subscription</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Under the topic name, right-click <ui>Subscriptions</ui>, then click <ui>Create New Subscription</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Repeat step 2 if you want to create more subscriptions to the topic.
trans-unit.target: Repeat step 2 if you want to create more subscriptions to the topic.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>New Subscription</ui> dialog, give the subscription a name and set any desired properties.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>New Subscription</ui> dialog, give the subscription a name and set any desired properties.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the name of the topic in Server Explorer, and then click <ui>Send a test message</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the name of the topic in Server Explorer, and then click <ui>Send a test message</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the subscription you created in step 2, then click <ui>Receive message</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the subscription you created in step 2, then click <ui>Receive message</ui>.

trans-unit.source: You can repeat this step for every subscription you created in step 3, and each subscription receives a copy of the same message.
trans-unit.target: You can repeat this step for every subscription you created in step 3, and each subscription receives a copy of the same message.
